properties.displayName: Potential Persistence Via Custom Protocol Handler
properties.query:
DeviceRegistryEvents
| where (RegistryValueData startswith "URL:" and RegistryKey startswith "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\CLASSES") and (not(((InitiatingProcessFolderPath startswith "C:\\Program Files (x86)" or InitiatingProcessFolderPath startswith "C:\\Program Files\\" or InitiatingProcessFolderPath startswith "C:\\Windows\\System32\\" or InitiatingProcessFolderPath startswith "C:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\") or RegistryValueData startswith "URL:ms-")))

tags.name: description
tags.value: Detects potential persistence activity via the registering of a new custom protocole handlers. While legitimate applications register protocole handlers often times during installation. And attacker can abuse this by setting a custom handler to be used a
